attributes.action: Allow Gert Wilders to enter the United Kingdom.
attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background:
Dutch MP Gert Wilders has been banned from entering the United Kingdom by the Home Office, who have vaguely argued that 'this man's presence would cause hatred'.

Mr. Wilders has been invited by a British Lord merely to view his film, 'Fitna', and not to make a public speech.

The pressure brought by Lord Ahmed, who had previously threatened the House of Lords authorities that he would bring a force of 10,000 Muslims to the Lords if Wilders was allowed to speak, is a subversion of our great democracy.

Gert Wilders should be allowed to come to Britain and have the freedom of speech a legal representive of a fellow European government would expect to have anywhere else in Europe.

Allow Mr. Wilders to enter the United Kingdom.

reasons: Duplicate - this is similar to and/or overlaps with an existing petition or petitions
